situation.title: Mode of operation
situation.meta_description: Rules for restaurants, pubs, bars and clubs.

content.processed:
As of 3 March, 2021, it will be possible to consume meals in the canteens, but only one customer will be allowed to sit at smaller tables. In the case of a long table, there must be a spacing of 2 m between individuals, or a mechanical barrier preventing the spread of droplets (e.g. plexiglass).

Rules and recommendations

Restaurants, pubs, bars and clubs are now closed including the restaurant gardens. However, it is possible to have a takeout window open from 5 AM to 8:59 PM. Food deliveries can work all day. Only soft drinks (hot/cold) and food can be sell out of the dispensing window. Beverages can be sell as well, but they must be consumed at home. If you decide to consume the food outside, you must keep the 2 m spacing. 

The exception is restaurants that are not for the public - these are typically employee canteens or catering providers of health and social services (e.g. canteens in sick, elderly homes) or prisons. The second exception are the restaurants in accommodation facilities, which provide food to their guests (e.g. breakfast for hotel guests) – these can operate from 5:00 to 20:59.

Drinking alcohol is prohibited in the area of restaurant establishments, their surroundings and in all public places (e.g. parks, stops, housing estates, squares, shops, etc.).

When you are buying takeaway food, have your mouth and nose covered at all times, keep at least 2 meters of distance from other customers and restaurant staff, use disinfectant and prefer card payment.

The more we protect ourselves, the sooner we can go back to eating in restaurants.

questions_answers.question: Can I have a wedding party or a wake at a restaurant?
Can I have a family party at a restaurant?
Does the ban on restaurants apply to confectioneries, cafes and bakeries?
Can I have a takeout window?
questions_answers.value: Yes, from 5:00 to 20:59. Disinfect the takeout window regularly (at least every 2 hours).

questions_answers.question: Can I have my food delivered home?
questions_answers.value: Yes, food delivery services can still operate.

questions_answers.question: Are restaurant gardens allowed to be open?
questions_answers.value: No. But the same measures apply as for other establishments selling meals.

questions_answers.question: Do hotel restaurants work?
questions_answers.value: Currently hotels are closed. However, once they are opened, they will be exempt and will be able to provide meals to guests.

questions_answers.question: Do staff canteens work?
questions_answers.value: Yes, staff canteens which are serving only the staff not the public have an exception to the ban. However, you cannot consume the meal in the premises of the canteen. In order to consume your meal you have to take it outside for example to your office. Thus, you cannot sit with your colleagues at one table during lunch break.

questions_answers.question: Can I eat my meal in front of the restaurant?
questions_answers.value: Yes, you can consume the meal bought in the restaurant outside, but you must keep the two-meters distance from others. People should avoid clustering, so if it is possible, take your meal home and eat it there.

questions_answers.question: How can restaurants in a shopping mall (5000m2 and above) operate?
questions_answers.value: They can have a dispensing window, or use courier services and deliver food / drinks to customers.

questions_answers.question: Can I buy a beer in a PET bottle?
questions_answers.value: Yes, you can buy it through a dispensing window of your favourite restaurant or brewery. Bear in mind, that you have to consume it at home.
